Sure, I understand the definition of Internal Attributional Style (IAS) and how it refers to attributing causes of events or behaviors to internal factors related to the self, such as personality, ability, motivation, or emotions.

Please provide the Event you'd like me to generate an IAS attribution social media post for.
Transferred_Post:
I'm ready to help. Please go ahead and provide the posts you'd like me to transform from Internal Attributional Style (IAS) to External Attributional Style (EAS). I'll respond with the transferred posts in the required format.

Please provide the posts!

Post:
"I'm so grateful for the time we had together, but I'm also angry at myself for not being able to say goodbye properly. I feel like I'll never be able to forgive myself for this."

Event: My mom told me someone I care about has passed away.

Explanation: In this situation, the individual is attributing the cause of their distress (not being able to say goodbye properly) to their own inadequacies (feeling angry at themselves). This is an example of internal attributional style because the individual is blaming themselves for something that is outside of their control.
Transferred_Post: "I'm so grateful for the time we had together, but I'm also angry about the circumstances that didn't allow me to say goodbye properly. I feel like the suddenness of the loss makes it hard for me to process."
